Suppose a system of linear equations with n variables has
rank
Recall: the rank of a system of linear equations is the number of leading 1 's in the non-augmented part of its RREF-matrix
r<n . If its RREF-matrix has no leading 1 in the augmentation column, then this system has infinitely many solutions. Moreover, number values for all variables whose associated columns do not contain a leading 1 may be chosen freely, and each such set of choices determines unique values for the remaining variables which solve the system.
